intro: Tephrosia capillipes, commonly known as the slender tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, with five petals. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several small, oval-shaped leaflets. Tephrosia capillipes is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
